head.supplied: Bot Garden, 12/5/71 ¶ ¶ It affords me much pleasure, Mr Pascoe, to send you a case full of plants this day by rail. The selection has been made as much as possible in accordance with your wishes, but...

div.p: No. 4198, unit 2, VPRS 578 Echuca borough letters received 1871, Municipalities, Public Record Office, Victoria.

It affords me much pleasure, Mr Pascoe, to send you a case full of plants this day by rail. The selection has been made as much as possible in accordance with your wishes, but I regret I had no larger plants nor all kinds but have done my best.

You will be aware that last year my departmental funds became largely reduced, so that I cannot furnish as much to public institutions as in former years, nor be otherwise as useful to them as before.
A bundle of large Elms is sent also. If you want yet anything particularly you must let me know.

p.style: font-family: Geneva; font-size: 12pt; margin-left: 1.75in; margin-right: 0in; text-indent: 0in;
